Description: Rim sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two added white bands low down; exterior: rim pattern consisting of maeander alternating with squares filled with cross squares and maeanders; below, square and stroke pattern between narrow bands; below, vertical dividing bands consisting of part of square with maeander, and to its right paired hook maeander band between dot and billet bands. Drip of glaze on lip.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, a set of sherds which display patterns on the different parts of the vessel that are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 238, no. 179)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0130) (phase 2)
